description: Autobiographical numbers (or curious numbers): numbers n = x0 x1 x2...x9 such that xi is the number of digits equal to i in n.
comments: Proof of completeness based on: x0 > 0; xi > 2 only if i = 0; for i > 2, xi = 1 if i = x0, xi = 0 otherwise.Enumerated by David Castro (david_castro(AT)retek.com).
references: E. Angelini, "Jeux de suites", in Dossier Pour La Science, pp. 32-35, Volume 59 (Jeux math'), April/June 2008, Paris.
M. Gardner, Mathematical Circus, pp. 128; 135 Prob. 7 Alfred A. Knopf NY 1979.
Tanya Khovanova, A Story of Storytelling Numbers, Math. Horizons, Sep 2009, 14-17.
links: Fred Gavin, Letters to the editor, Math. Mag 66 (4) (1993) p 276.
example: n = 1210 has one 0, two 1's, one 2 and zero 3's and n = "one two one zero".
mathematica: isSelfDescribing[n_Integer] := (RotateRight[DigitCount[n]] == PadRight[IntegerDigits[n], 10]); Select[Range[10^10 - 1], isSelfDescribing] (* _Martin Ettl_, Oct 09 2012 *)
author: Robert Leduc (leduc(AT)macalester.edu)
